docs.snippet: Walter C. Sauer, vice chairman of the Export-Import Bank, defended yesterday the bank's policy of lending money to foreign governments as justified as long as it helps prepare the ground for private investment.

docs.snippet: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., April 6 -- Dr. Raul Prebisch, secretary general of the United Nations Trade and Development Conference, appealed strongly today against any expansion of what he termed "discriminatory preferential systems" in interna tional...
docs.lead_paragraph: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., April 6 -- Dr. Raul Prebisch, secretary general of the United Nations Trade and Development Conference, appealed strongly today against any expansion of what he termed "discriminatory preferential systems" in interna tional trade and urged their liquidation.
docs.abstract: sec gen Prebisch asks abolition of 'discretionary preferential systems' such as those given former French territories in Africa by EEC

headline.main: Abolition of Preferential Tariff Systems Is Urged; PREFERENTIAL AID ON DUTIES SCORED

docs.snippet: RIO DE JANEIRO, April 10 -- The Brazilian Air Force denied today that two of its planes had violated Uruguayan airspace in pursuit of a mysterious private plane.

docs.snippet: SALVADOR, Brazil -- Freighter vacations are automatically rejected by some travelers because of the notion that it is necessary to wait a year or so for a room. This is so for some of the freighters headed for the best advertised and most popular...
docs.lead_paragraph: SALVADOR, Brazil -- Freighter vacations are automatically rejected by some travelers because of the notion that it is necessary to wait a year or so for a room. This is so for some of the freighters headed for the best advertised and most popular ports during the most popular vacation times. But it is not always so.
docs.abstract: D Janson article on freighter Mormaclynx (Moore-McCormack) trip to S Amer ports

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, April 16 -- President Johnson is preparparing the biggest shift in diplomatic assignments in four years. The program will involve changes in at least five major State Department jobs and more than a dozen United States embassies.

docs.snippet: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., April 22 -- The Special Committee on Colonialism urged Britain today to act immediately to cancel elections scheduled for May 7 in Southern Rhodesia that are expected to confirm the grip of the white minority on the Government.
